title.native: ソードアート・オンライン

description:
In the near future, a Virtual Reality Massive Multiplayer Online Role-Playing Game (VRMMORPG) called Sword Art Online has been released where players control their avatars with their bodies using a piece of technology called Nerve Gear. One day, players discover they cannot log out, as the game creator is holding them captive unless they reach the 100th floor of the game's tower and defeat the final boss. However, if they die in the game, they die in real life. Their struggle for survival starts now...

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: ซอร์ดอาร์ตออนไลน์

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Fairy
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a fairy.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Prison
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a prison.

tags.name: Fishing
tags.description: Centers around the sport of fishing.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Rape
tags.description: Features non-consensual sexual penetration.

tags.name: Inseki
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations among step, adopted, and other non-blood related family members.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Rescue
tags.description: Centers around operations that carry out urgent treatment of injuries, remove people from danger, or save lives. This includes series that are about search-and-rescue teams, trauma surgeons, firefighters, and more.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

node.description:
__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

[Profile](https://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=74) | [Website](https://hayamisaoriofficial.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayami_official)  | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtUcK6HrhD024CkPDsURBwg) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hayamisaori_official/)

Member of the duet [Blue Drops](https://anilist.co/staff/106305/Blue-Drops) with [Hitomi Yoshida](https://anilist.co/staff/101088/Hitomi-Yoshida).

**Non-Anime Roles:**
- Elisanne (Dragalia Lost)
- Kamisato Ayaka (Genshin Impact)
- Munechika (Utawarerumono)
- Pramanix (Arknights)
- Rei Shijo (Princess Connect! Re:Dive)
- Tao Isonokami (Shin Megami Tensei V)
- Vector (Girls' Frontline)
- Shimakaze (Azur Lane)
- Kirifuji Nagisa (Blue Archive)
- Kunimitsu II (Tekken 7)
- Emma Millstein (The Legend of Heroes Series)
- Hulkenberg (Metaphor: ReFantazio)
- Caeda (Fire Emblem Heroes)

__Height:__ 165 cm

[Website](https://www.tomatsuharuka.com/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/tomatsuharuka-blog)

Tomatsu debuted in 2007, starring in Shinkyoku Soukai Polyphonica as Corticarte Apa Lagranges. Since then, she has had other major roles such as Lala Satalin Deviluke in To Love-Ru and Shiho Sannomiya in Zettai Karen Children. Before graduating from high school in 2008, she used to live in Ichimomiya city where she often took the shinkansen, traveling back and forth between Nagoya and Tokyo to attend recordings. On January 11, 2019, she married a man from outside the entertainment industry.

One of the members of the voice actress unit [Sphere](https://anilist.co/staff/103636).

__Non-anime roles:__
- Mary - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fion0806) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100001583365922) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0BLHMPWOZ2aTI0ZCCbtZem) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/yuki-kajiura/251013990) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/4663498)

Yuki Kajiura was born in Japan but raised in West Germany for most of her childhood. Her father was a big fan of classical and opera music and always desired for Yuki to play the piano for him. Yuki eventually gained a love for music and a love for the piano. Yuki started out as an SE programmer, but changed to music in 1992. She made her grand debut with a female trio called "[See-Saw](https://anilist.co/staff/104342)."  In the years to come the group released six singles and two albums. 

Yuki then went on to work on her solo career composing for artists and some TV, films, and games, such as _Blood: The Last Vampire_ in 2001, and _Xenosaga II_ and _III_. In 2001, Yuki's claim to fame came with the release of the anime [_NOIR_](https://anilist.co/anime/272). The soundtrack sold 50,000 copies. In 2002, she was brought on to project .hack to write the score to [_.hack//SIGN_](https://anilist.co/anime/48), along with vocalist [Chiaki Ishikawa](https://anilist.co/staff/101059) and New York singer [Emily Bindiger](https://anilist.co/staff/103845). Shortly after Yuki comprised an album of original and complied songs known as Fiction, working again with Emily Bindiger as well as _Xenosaga_ vocalist Deb Lyons.  

Yuki's other well-known works were for [_Mobile Suite Gundam Seed_](https://anilist.co/anime/93), which hit 5th on the Oricon Charts its first week, and selling over 200,000 copies. Yuki has also become known for her work on CLAMP's [_Tsubasa Chronicle_](https://anilist.co/anime/177) series, [movie](https://anilist.co/anime/807), and [OVAs](https://anilist.co/anime/2685). In 2003, she formed the project [FictionJunction](https://anilist.co/staff/103691) in which pairs Yuki's songwriting and composition with different performing vocalists, first as separate solo works and later into a singular group. In 2007, Yuki formed the band [Kalafina](https://anilist.co/staff/101975), with two partners from FictionJunction, Wakana Ootaki and [Keiko Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/104664), to perform for the anime [_Kara no Kyoukai_](https://anilist.co/anime/2593), further working on several others. Kalafina disbanded in 2018, with their final lineup including Wakana, Keiko, and [Hikaru](https://anilist.co/staff/168857).

Akira Amemiya is an animator and up-and-coming director best known for directing [SSSS.GRIDMAN](https://anilist.co/anime/99424/SSSSGRIDMAN) and being Studio Trigger founder [Hiroyuki Imaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/97349/Hiroyuki-Imaishi)'s protege. Amemiya's [animation and directing](https://blog.sakugabooru.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/mini-imaishi.mp4) is very similar to Imaishi's yet is less chaotic and contains more 'retro' devices like impact frames and multi-tonal shading, drawing a lot of inspiration from [Masami Obari](https://anilist.co/staff/100660/Masami-Obari). For these reasons he was frequently typecasted for old school pose-heavy mecha combat.

Amemiya is a nerdy director whose anime often heavily references other series and artists he loves, sometimes even replicating Obari's [animation sequences](https://blog.sakugabooru.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/dangaioh2.mp4) and [layouts](https://i.imgur.com/nTRdM4K.jpg), [Transformer](https://twitter.com/SSS_SGRID/status/1051063114022572033)'s color designs, and Hideaki Anno's [establishing shots](https://blog.sakugabooru.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/welcome-to-the-anno-class.jpg) as well as long-lingering framing. Amemiya called Anno's [Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/Evangelion/) his [favorite series before](https://i.imgur.com/nEYK186.png). Between his ode-heavy artistry he interjects personality with [subtle details](https://blog.sakugabooru.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/what-kind-of-brand-is-TOMATO-LIFE-tho.jpg), visual gags, and repurposing tonally contrasting homages into a different context.

Amemiya graduated from Tokyo University of Technology and was part of the university's anime research society. During his time there he became heavily influenced by Osaka University's anime research club [Group CAS](https://twitter.com/group_cas). At the time [Toshiyuki Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/107357/Toshiyuki-Satou) was part of the group, while [Ikehata Hiroshi](https://anilist.co/staff/120505/Ikehata-Hiroshi) visited regularly. After a bit of indie work Amemiya joined studio Gainax and climbed up the hierarchy: from clean-up to animation direction, onto storyboarding and episode directing, until after joining studio Trigger and co-directing Kill la Kill finally having the credentials to debut with his own series.

He is married to animator [Megumi Kouno](https://anilist.co/staff/120602/Megumi-Kouno).
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岩浪美和) | [Twitter](https://x.com/i/user/169097071)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t_bamboo)

He grew up in Mexico because of his parents' work. In elementary school he read Ishinomori Shoutarou's Cyborg 009. Later he experienced the Yamato and Gundam boom, prompting him to be interested in animation. He started working as background artist, later becoming freelance. During that time Takeda got acquainted with Tokuhiro Hiragi and Tatsuya Kushida, whom he then helped establishing the art studio Bihou in 1993.

In 2005 he established the independent art studio Bamboo, which became a company in 2007.

(Source: AniDB)

[Website](http://remi-stargarnet.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Remi_Official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/remi_stargarnet/)

REMI is a female singer born in Tokyo, Japan. She is currently a member of [Sound Horizon](https://anilist.co/staff/100754/) and often works on [Yasuharu Takanashi](https://anilist.co/staff/100070)'s soundtracks.

[Website](http://www.lxixsxa.com/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/lxixsxa/) | [Profile (Anison)](http://anison.info/data/person/29206.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/LiSA_OLiVE) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/xlisa_olivex/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/lisaSMEJ) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/lxixsxa.jp) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA_(Japanese_musician,_born_1987)) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA)

LiSA is a Japanese singer, songwriter and lyricist from Seki, Gifu. LiSA started her own band while in high school to catch a growing wave of punk rock. In 2008, she moved to Tokyo in order to further her musical career. The name "LiSA" stands for "Love is Same All" or "LiVE is Smile Always."

She announced her marriage to voice actor and singer [Tatsuhisa Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95735/Tatsuhisa-Suzuki) on January 22, 2020.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomohikoito0218)

Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomohikoito0218)

Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomohikoito0218)

Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/).
[Website](http://afortoftinplate.web.fc2.com) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buriki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/ブリキ_%28イラストレーター%29)

__Current Residence:__ Nerima, Tokyo, Japan
__Doujin Circle:__ WordGear

Kawahara Reki graduated from the Aoyama Gakuin University.

[Official Website](http://wordgear.sblo.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kunori)

[Official Website ](https://www.aoieir.com/) | [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/eir_ruru) | [YouTube ](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZ7B1oCEDT_d4c9XTtChX7w) | [Instagram ](https://www.instagram.com/aoieir/) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/18moNotPmBWa2YZtRnIoZ3?autoplay=true)

Aoi Eir is a Japanese pop singer signed to SME Records. She was discovered through Nico Nico Douga video sharing network. Like other Nico Nico Douga artists, not much of her personal information is revealed.   

Eir has loved singing since she was a child, at high school period, she sung in a band she had formed. After graduating from high school, she gave up her music career but continued performing publicly. Her impressive and beautiful voice are easily recognizable and she has been selected to sing the closing song for TV animation “Fate/Zero” which was released as her debut single called “MEMORIA” on October 19, 2011.
Representative director of [Aniplex](https://anilist.co/studio/17/). Board Director at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/watanabesho)__ | __[Blog (jp)](https://ameblo.jp/shoooou/)__ | __[Artist Profile (Smile Company)](https://www.smile-co.jp/archives/creator/431)__

Shou Watanabe is a Japanese keyboardist, lyricist, composer, arranger and member of three-piece rock band [Sajou no Hana](https://anilist.co/staff/137163/).

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/watanabesho)__ | __[Blog (jp)](https://ameblo.jp/shoooou/)__ | __[Artist Profile (Smile Company)](https://www.smile-co.jp/archives/creator/431)__

Shou Watanabe is a Japanese keyboardist, lyricist, composer, arranger and member of three-piece rock band [Sajou no Hana](https://anilist.co/staff/137163/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/johnsama) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/75255)

Noted for his work in the [Sword Art Online](https://anilist.co/anime/11757/) franchise.

Married to fellow animator [Haruko Iizuka](https://anilist.co/staff/105678/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/johnsama) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/75255)

Noted for his work in the [Sword Art Online](https://anilist.co/anime/11757/) franchise.

Married to fellow animator [Haruko Iizuka](https://anilist.co/staff/105678/).

Luna Haruna is a punk/loli reader model of KERA magazine. She was a finalist in the 4th Animax Anisong Grand Prix as Aya Itou (伊藤彩).  

[Blog](https://ameblo.jp/harunaluna-official) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/luna_galaxy) | [Official Website](https://www.harunaluna.jp/)

[Official website](http://bunplusbun.sakura.ne.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/bunbun922) | [Blog (abec)](http://abec.blog93.fc2.com/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/bunbun_plus) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/8142) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/c/BUNBUN922)

His older sister is [Yukiko Horiguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/102497/Yukiko-Horiguchi).

Major illustration works: 
- Kare Kanojo and Summon Magic (カレとカノジョと召喚魔法)
- Mary Rose (薔薇のマリア) - We AI (僕らA.I) 
- Shinkyoku Soukai Polyphonica Black Series (神曲奏界ポリフォニカ ブラック・シリーズ) 
- Girl with Radio Jamming (ラジオガール・ウィズ・ジャミング) 
- Zoahanta (ゾアハンター) (with Junichi Osako, author of Polyphonica Black) 
- Asuka 
- Garouden Mahjon - (アスカ -麻雀餓狼伝-) 
- All Death War (全死大戦)  

Other works: 
- Illustrations BUNBUN (illustration collection) 
- Rondo of Swords (DS game - character designs) 
- Shinkyoku Soukai Polyphonia THE BLACK (PC Game / Kinetic Novel - character designs).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/857636909861920768)

Returned to the industry in August 2020, after having previously retired in 2014.
